intro: Spermacoce santacruciana, commonly known as the sacred nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when ripe. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges. The species is noted for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
